summary: This is a court order from Judge Richard M. Berman scheduling a status conference for August 27, 2019, regarding the proposed dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The order outlines the purpose of the hearing, which is to address the public's informational interest in the dismissal process, and indicates that counsel for the government, the deceased defendant, and the victims will be heard.

As United States Attorney, Geoffrey Berman's office was prosecuting the case against Jeffrey Epstein and was involved in the victim notification process related to the case's dismissal.

events.title: Status Conference on Dismissal of Indictment
events.description: A court hearing scheduled by Judge Richard M. Berman to address the proposed nolle prosequi (dismissal) of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death, allowing counsel for the government, the defendant, and victims to be heard.

events.title: Proposal of Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed an order to dismiss the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein to the court.

locations: Courtroom 17B (presumably in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died before judgment was entered in his criminal case, leading to a proposal to dismiss the indictment.
Judge Richard M. Berman scheduled a hearing to address the public's informational interest in the dismissal process, even though the defendant was deceased.
The hearing was set for August 27, 2019, at 10:30 AM, allowing victims and their counsel an opportunity to be heard.
The document is a victim notification from the U.S. Department of Justice, indicating ongoing official communication with potential victims of the case.
The case reference numbers are 2018R01618 and 19-CR-00490, linking this notification to the specific federal prosecution.
